metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5129 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Google V8 before 5.2.361.32, as used in Google Chrome before 52.0.2743.82, does not properly process left-trimmed objects, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted JavaScript code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5129` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
chromium-browser-l10n - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
chromium-chromedriver - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
